settings.content:
When you purchase exercise equipment from Sole or one of our authorized retailers, you are doing more than just buying a product. You are making an investment in your future self. Buying exercise equipment for the home is a commitment to improve your life. You need a machine that will match your commitment and be with you for the long haul.

Your warranty is specific to your particular machine. To review the details of your machine's warranty, locate your Owner's Manual at the link below.

Click here to find you Owner's Manual

settings.text: What is excluded from the warranty?

settings.content:
Review your machine's product warranty in the Owner's Manual to understand all details of coverage in the event your machine becomes defective or in need of repairs. As a general rule, your machine's warranty excludes the following:

  • Consequential, collateral, or incidental damages such as property damage and incidental expenses resulting from any breach of the written and/or implied warranty. Note: Some states do not allow the exclusion or limitation of incidental or consequential damages, so this limitation or exclusion may not apply to you.
  • Service call reimbursement to the consumer. Service call reimbursement to the dealer that does not involve malfunction or defects in workmanship or material, for units that are beyond the warranty period, for units that are beyond the service call reimbursement period, for machine's not requiring component replacement, or machine's not in ordinary household use.
  • Damages caused by services performed by persons other than authorized SOLE Fitness service companies; use of parts other than original SOLE Fitness parts; or external causes such as corrosion, discoloration of paint or plastic, alterations, modifications, abuse, misuse, accident, improper maintenance, inadequate power supply, or acts of God.
  • Products that have been: sold, transferred, bartered, or given to a third party.
  • Products that are used as floor models.
  • Products that have not been registered within the registration deadline. Proof of purchase and registration may be requested. 
  • Product use in any environment other than a residential setting unless it is one of our light commercial models.

settings.text: How can I submit a warranty claim?

settings.content: Please go to Support > Forms > Warranty Request and fill out the form.

settings.text: How can I submit a warranty claim?

settings.content: Please go to Support > Forms > Warranty Request and fill out the form.

settings.text: Where do I locate my serial number?

settings.content:
Your serial number is located on the front lower base of the treadmills, printed on a burgundy sticker. Please provide all numbers and or letters printed on this sticker.
Example – 5638860606000024.

For ellipticals it is on the mast just below the flywheel cover. 
For Spin bikes it is on the backside of the chain cover
For Upright and Recumbent bikes it is at the base of the console mast just under the cover.

SOLE proudly offers a satisfaction guarantee promise on all our products!
Give it your all for 30 days, and if our product doesn’t fit your needs, you can return it!
For more specific information please reference our guarantee page and/or use the form below:

*Returns will not be accepted after the 30 day trial period.

settings.text: What should I use to lubricate the deck and how often?

settings.content:
Your treadmill comes with one tube of “Lube” and extra tubes can be ordered directly from Sole Fitness or your authorized Sole Fitness dealer. You may also use a Lube-n-Walk kit that can be purchased through both aforementioned sellers. You need to use 2-3 ounces of lubrication each application. The belt & deck come pre-lubricated and subsequent lubrication should be performed every 90 hours of use, or every 90 days, regardless of usage as it can dry out. You will want to periodically check to make sure the deck is not dry.

Do not lubricate with anything other than 100% Silicone lubricant for treadmills. (DO NOT USE SILICONE CAULKING FOR BATHROOM AND KITCHEN PROJECTS OR A LUBRICANT THAT HAS A SPRAY/FOAM BASE)

Keeping the deck lubricated at the recommended intervals ensures the longest life possible for your treadmill. If the lubricant dries out, the friction between the belt and deck rises and places undue stress on the drive motor, drive belt and electronic motor control board, which could result in catastrophic failure of these expensive components. Failure to lubricate the deck at

regular intervals may void the warranty.

Use the following procedure to apply the silicone lubricant:

1. Turn the power switch off and unplug the power cord from the wall outlet.

2. Measure 18" from the edge of the motor cover; kneel down and reach under the belt approximately 4- 6” from one edge. Squirt a line of lubricant about 1/8” wide x 15" long in an “S” pattern perpendicular to the motor cover.

3. Repeat the process on the opposite side.

4. Plug the electrical cord back into the outlet and turn the power switch on.

5. Walk on the belt at a moderate speed for five minutes to evenly distribute the silicone lube.

*This applies to all Sole treadmills with the exception of the TT8. The TT8 model has a wax coating that is infused into the deck. It generally withstands up to 20,000 miles of use on the original side. It can then be flipped to the other side. As it wears down the user can reapply paraffin wax.
